result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher K Easley not in court.  Attorney Robert Taylor in court for Christopher K Easley.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Court ordered remand to court upon return of the bench warrant. No action taken as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Christopher K Easley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen in court for Christopher K Easley.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for initial appearance.  Court is in trial on another matter.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher K Easley not in court.  Attorney Robert Taylor for Amanda R. Kremer in court for Christopher K Easley.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for initial appearance.  Defendant failing to appear. Statements by parties. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher K Easley not in court.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Defendant appeared for case before Branch 46.  Defendant does not yet have counsel in this matter.  Case has not had an initial appearance.  Court set an initial appearance date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
There needs to be a hearing.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher K Easley not in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status of counsel.  Public Defender's Office has yet to appoint counsel.  Attorney Amanda Kremer has been appointed at county expense on his pending matters in Branch 46, Judge Feiss's court.  Attorney Amanda Kremer notified of next court date.  Court scheduled another status of counsel date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Received and Filed: SPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant contacted Branch 46 regarding Initial Appearance. 
Per COVID-19 protocol, Defendant is not able to appear in Court.
Parties will reschedule Initial Appearance.

**JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE SHELTON, BRANCH 40.**
Defendant Christopher K Easley in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Defendant has Case 20CF1296 pending in Branch 46. The Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Mr. Easley in Case 20CF1296. For reasons stated on the record, Court VACATED ARREST WARRANT. Court ordered case adjourned for Initial Appearance in OCCR. 
Initial Appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 221 of the Safety Building.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Christopher K Easley not in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/25/2022 @ 1p
